name: Meet for Coffee to talk DevOps
description:
This meetup is very informal - it is a show up, have a coffee and chat about work kind of thing.

Basically, it's all about making your systems and services more reliable, so typical topics might be configuration management, deployment, monitoring or the quirks of deploying on AWS/Google Compute Engine/Azure or on-premise hardware, whether in a server room or a data center, but the discussion topics are really up to whoever is there.

I'm the tall guy with a goatee and a light brown leather backpack. If other people haven't shown up yet I'll have my laptop out and the lid is encrusted with tech stickers. I'm fairly hard to miss.

Don't feel you have to stay for the whole 90 minutes - show up when you can, get your caffeine, stay as long as you want, then go.
how_to_find_us: I've got a tan leather backpack, am usually wearing a geeky t shirt, and my laptop lid is covered in nerdy stickers that any ops or SRE type will recognize.

description:

Basically, it's all about making your systems and services more reliable, so typical topics might be configuration management, deployment, monitoring or the quirks of deploying on AWS/Google Compute Engine/Azure or private hardware, whether in a server room or a data center, but the discussion is really up to whoever is there.

I'm the tall guy with a goatee and a light brown leather backpack. If other people haven't shown up yet I'll have my laptop out and the lid is encrusted with tech stickers. I'm hard to miss.

Don't feel you have to stay for the whole two hours - show up when you can, get your caffeine, stay as long as you want, then go.
how_to_find_us: I've got a tan leather backpack, am usually wearing a geeky t shirt, a red Red Hat hat and my laptop lid is covered in nerdy stickers that any ops type will recognize.

name: Deploy Your Web App on AWS Like a Champ
description:
Deployments can be hard but understanding the infrastructure and options available to you are essential in today's world of cloud computing. Ben Libell, resident AWS expert extraodinaire, will be your guide for an evening of deployment fun and learning. Learn about API Gateway, Elastic Load Balancer, Lamdas, S3 and more and how they can be used to bring your app to the masses.

• What we'll do
5:30-6:30 Meet and Greet / Dinner (Pizza and Drinks Provided)
6:30-8:00 Main Topic Discussion
8:00-9:00 Mingle

• What we’ll cover

Deployments on AWS

* Livestream
To be announced

• What to bring
Yourself, a friend, and some excitement to learn!
how_to_find_us: Take the elevator up to the 8th floor.

name: Monthly DenverScript Meetup
description:
6:15 pm: Intro and What's going on in JavaScript Land? (20min)

We'll be talking about new/exciting things going on in the industry. If you have something you think we should mention, feel free to tweet us @DenverScript (https://twitter.com/denverscript).

6:35 pm: Job Announcements

Anyone with a job opening can come up to the front and announce it to the group.

6:45 pm: Shorter Presentation(8 - 10min):

Decoupling Child from Parent - Phil Lucks

Should a parent component care about when a child component renders, or should the child own itself and tell the parent to MYOB? This topic will cover the pros & cons of coupled components and why you may choose one over the other. Ideally, the audience will participate too so everyone can learn from the experiences of others.

Phil has been working as a Front-End Engineer for over 3 years. If I'm lucky I remember the code I wrote from 1 week ago.

7:00 pm: Longer Presentation(20 - 30min):

Brief Intro to SvelteJS - Courtney Fay

What is Svelte? What makes it different than other frameworks out there? How does it work under the hood? (I'll try to make any JS connections possible) Why is everyone so psyched about it? Is it really the next big thing? How can I get started on my first Svelte project?

Court graduated from General Assembly's web dev program in Dec 2016. She spent 2017 helping make bank websites at IHS Markit, and just started her second dev job at a startup that she thinks has the potential to reduce the cost of healthcare in America.

Socialize:

We'll have beer and pizza! We'll also allow people to announce any job opportunities they may have at that time so you can socialize with potential applicants.

name: Halloween Costume Party DenverUX combined with Develop Happy Hour!
description:
You asked for it and now you’re going to get it. Halloween Costume Happy Hour at our most requested venue, Casa Bonita! We’re joining forces with Develop Happy Hour to bring you Casa Bonita costume glory!! Come mingle, wear a costume (let’s get nerdy), have a Casarita and enjoy the spectacle. NOTE: They close at 9 pm so come early.

Hang out with fellow members of the growing Denver/Boulder tech scene. Everyone is welcome. Come to learn, make contacts or discuss your latest project. No speaker, no agenda, no code knowledge necessary, just drinks.

name: October Develop Happy Hour
description:
Come hang out with fellow members of the growing Denver/Boulder tech scene. Everyone is welcome. Come to learn, make contacts or discuss your latest project. No speaker, no agenda, no code knowledge necessary, just drinks.

Monthly Happy Hour. We are always open to suggestions for new venues to host the happy hour. Please feel free to message the us with any ideas.
how_to_find_us: We'll be enjoying the views of Sloans Lake from the rooftop patio.

name: Beginner's Night
description:
We'll be helping beginners get started with Elm.

Come with your computer and a bunch of questions, we'll make sure you can get home and write code in Elm!

If you have a lightning talk you'd like to introduce, feel free to come and present it too!

We love getting a diverse group of people, from beginners to experts, so if you are on the fence about coming out, just go for it!
how_to_find_us:
Enter the West End Plaza (look for the Pivotal sign) and take the elevator to Level 5.

If elevator to level 5 is disabled, go to level 4 and walk the last one, thanks!

name: Front Range Front-End Meetup
description:
Learn about front-end topics, including:

HTML: accessibility, semantic markup CSS: new techniques, tools like PostCSS & Sass JS: vanilla JS, browser APIs Design: UX, UI, pattern libraries, animation Performance: image optimization, SVG, refactoring

name: JAMstack Denver Meetup - November
description:
Details TBA!

JAMstack Denver is hosted at Code Talent.
You can find us at 3412 Blake Street from 6ish to 8ish on the first Wednesdays of each month. Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station. Can't make it out this month? No worries, we're streaming live to Twitch and YouTube!
https://www.twitch.tv/jamstackdenver/
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkvjCJHilRhXoalNm9pNPYg

Please read our Code of Conduct below: https://www.meetup.com/JAMstack-Denver/pages/28543529/JAMstack_Denver_Code_of_Conduct
how_to_find_us: Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station
